Here's what i'm working on:

I need to scale the FRONT face of the cylinder between the nozzle arms (the arms will rotate up and down).

But is there a easier way like to scale the entire thing to be like a cone? (Like the stock one)

Edited December 30, 2015 by strykersm

I have not investigated fully, but I believe the stock implementation uses a SkinnedMeshRenderer -- this is a setup using bones / vertex groups that allows for scaling/adjusting certain parts of a mesh non-uniformly through animation/keyframe or plugin-based manipulation.  Otherwise no, there is no way to just scale one end of a cylinder.

You will likely need Blender / Maya / 3dsMax in order to setup a skinned-mesh renderer (called armatures in blender).  Do a google search regarding 'blender bone rigging' or something similar and you should find tutorials info to set that stuff up (not an expert myself, have only done some basic experimentation).

The SkinnedMeshRenderer is what is used to deform a mesh organically (e.g. for the Kerbals themselves), as opposed to moving around objects mechanically which the normal animation system does (e.g. like Minecraft characters; where the arms merely rotate on a pivot).

And as stated, I have not investigated the stock jet engine model/setup fully, so I'm not sure how they linked the skinned-mesh-renderer back into the engine module to control the actual animation;  not sure if is actually animation based or purely plugin based....  would likely need to ask Porkjet
